intro: Strychnos harmsii, commonly known as the African strychnos, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Loganiaceae and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant produces small, woody fruits that contain seeds, and it is often found in forested areas. Strychnos harmsii is notable for its chemical composition, which includes various alkaloids, though it is not as well-studied as other members of its genus.
